channel.title: Im sad, I cant play BM
channel.description: My PC cant handle Source engine ... I have downloaded TF2 and everything on low settings still its 15-20 fps ... even Alien Swarm on low settings is 15-20 fps and its unplayable :frowning: :frowning: :frowning:

item.title: Im sad, I cant play BM

item.description:
My god, what are you running on? A Pentium III soap box? Stop whinging, man up and get a better computer.

item.dc:creator: Physikant
item.description:
When hes got such framedrops in hl1, then its impossible for him to play TF2. Sounds like trolling.
I mean, he could post his hardware setup, so everyone could decide whats the best way to improve his performance. But he doesen’t.

Read full topic
item.source: Im sad, I cant play BM

item.title: Im sad, I cant play BM
item.dc:creator: shifty
item.description:
Dotard:

Well my PC is so low that even in hl1 when i turn on flashlight i got 10 fps

Are u sure there’s nothing on your computer that’s causing this? When i play i disable everything (antivirus, skype,msn etc) Did you try updating all your drivers and try setting your computer to run on best performance?

Dont mean to sound like an asshole or troll but saying ‘how crappy your pc is’ isn’t going to fix the problem. Its going to take a while for BMS to be released so you still have time to save up and buy new computer parts (or maybe a whole new computer). Just ask the people here the recommended configuration + the brand name, for a new computer hardware and then go to https://www.newegg.com and buy everything that is said. Its that simple and easy. The only hard part is saving up the money

Read full topic

item.title: Im sad, I cant play BM
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Orange box system requirements.

Minimum:
1.7 GHz Processor
512MB RAM
DirectX® 8.1 level Graphics Card (Requires support for SSE)
Windows® 7 (32/64-bit)/Vista/XP
Mouse
Keyboard

Recommended:
Pentium 4 processor (3.0GHz, or better)
1GB RAM
DirectX® 9 level Graphics Card
Windows® 7 (32/64-bit)/Vista/XP
Mouse
Keyboard

Here you can analyze your computer easily.
https://www.systemrequirementslab.com/cyri/

Read full topic
item.source: Im sad, I cant play BM

item.title: Im sad, I cant play BM
item.dc:creator: Flubly
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

Considering your eyes see at around 24, :rolleyes:

Your eyes can easily distinguish higher framerates from lower ones. 24 fps is popular because it creates a blur track to the human eye that’s similar to the motion blur we see in real life. The reason people like to play at higher frame rates is to not miss details in dropped frames. It’s more strategic than aesthetic.

Read full topic

I would come here before I went to a professional any ol’ day of the week.

item.source: Im sad, I cant play BM

item.title: Im sad, I cant play BM
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Dotard:

id tech 1 with a few lines from id 2

It doesn’t use the Doom engine. Or the Wolf 3d engine. Or the Commander Keen engine. (which one of those is considered id Tech 1? I’m too lazy to research this)

Dotard:

fps games require at least 30

Considering your eyes see at around 24, :rolleyes:

As I said, it is preferable to have above 24 constantly, but it in no way breaks the game completely as you suggest. I would say that point is at around 5 fps. Unless you’re playing multiplayer, in which case you want to lose as few frames as possible.

Read full topic
